dict.string: You can hike the entire length without a tent. There are 250 shelters spaced a dayâ€™s walk apart.
It takes the average person 165 days to complete the entire trail.
A typical hiker burns around 5500 calories a day when walking the Appalachian Trail.
Someone who aims to hike the whole trail in one shot is known as a "thru-hiker." "Day-hikers" or "section-hikers" do small portions of the trail.
Of the 2000 hikers who attempt to complete the entire trail each year, only 1 in 4 succeed.
The Appalachian is the longest hiking-only trail in the world
The entire trail is maintained by 31 different clubs of volunteers, making it the largest volunteer conservation project in the world.
Almost no part of the trail as it is today was part of the original trail. Most of it has either been rebuilt or rerouted.
The Skyline Drive follows the original path of the Appalachian trail.
The amount of elevation change on the trail amounts to roughly 16 Mt. Everests.
